message: Hello everyone! Just installed the monitoring dashboard but I can't find my node. Any ideas?
@user123 You need to look for your node ID in the dashboard. It should be listed under 'Active Nodes'
@helper456 I checked there, but I see multiple nodes. How do I know which one is mine?
Your node ID is shown in your config file, usually in ~/.config/myapp/config.yaml. Look for the 'node_id' field and match it with what you see in the dashboard.
Found it! Thanks for the help. One more question - is there a way to rename my node to something more recognizable?
Yes, you can rename your node in the dashboard. Click on your node, then select the 'Edit' option and change the display name.
Is anyone else having trouble with API rate limits? I'm getting 'Too many requests' errors.
@user789 We've increased the rate limits recently. Make sure you're using the latest client library (v2.3+) which handles rate limiting better.
I'm on v2.1, that explains it. Will upgrade now, thanks!
How do I get started with the documentation? There's so much information, not sure where to begin.
@newuser456 I'd recommend starting with the 'Getting Started' guide in the docs. Then move on to the 'Basic Concepts' section before diving into specific features.
Just deployed my first node to production! The monitoring looks great.
Having trouble with SSL certificates. Getting 'certificate validation failed' errors when connecting to the dashboard.
@user567 What version of OpenSSL are you using? We require 1.1.1 or newer.
I'm on 1.0.2, that's probably the issue. Will upgrade and try again.
Let us know if that resolves it. If not, check the certificate path in your config file.
In the monitoring dashboard, can I set up alerts for when my node goes offline?
@newuser789 Yes, click on the 'Alerts' tab, then 'Add Alert'. Select 'Node Status' as the metric and 'Offline' as the condition.
Found it, thanks! Is there a way to get these alerts via SMS instead of just email?
SMS alerts are coming in the next release (about 2 weeks). For now, you can use the webhook integration with a third-party SMS service if you need that functionality.
My node keeps crashing with 'Out of memory' errors. I have 4GB RAM allocated, is that not enough?
@user123 For the standard configuration, 4GB should be sufficient. Check if you have the 'extended-metrics' option enabled in your config. That can increase memory usage significantly.
Ah, I do have that enabled. I'll either disable it or increase the RAM. Thanks!
Just joined the project! Looking forward to learning and contributing.
Welcome @newbie101! Be sure to check out our onboarding documentation. Let us know if you have any questions.
Is there any way to export monitoring data to CSV or JSON? I'd like to do some custom analysis.
@user456 Yes, on the dashboard, click the gear icon at the top-right then 'Export Data'. You can choose CSV, JSON, or Excel formats.
Perfect, thank you!
Is the monitoring dashboard open source? I'd like to contribute some improvements.
@user890 Yes, it's all on GitHub! Check out github.com/ourproject/monitoring-dashboard. We welcome contributions - there's a CONTRIBUTING.md file with guidelines.
Excellent, I'll take a look and maybe submit a PR soon.
Quick question: how frequently does the monitoring dashboard refresh data? Mine seems stuck.
@user234 By default it's every 60 seconds. You can change this in Settings > Refresh Rate. If it's stuck, try clearing your browser cache or doing a hard refresh (Ctrl+F5).
Hard refresh worked, thanks!
